Posts.Content: Hello - a while back we discussed the new packaging of Arimidex.  Someone made the excellent suggestion to ask my pharmacy to refill with the loose pills in a bottle.  Yesterday I called in my refill and made that request.  I was told that I didn't have a choice and that's how they were shipped from manufacturer.  My 'pharmacy' (not of choice) is Caremark CVS; you may not have this dilemna.  Actually, Caremark is a very efficient, professional organization.  I don't know why I resisted so long having them manage and distribute my prescriptions. Guess I'll have to put my husband to work.  When three months' worth of Arimidex arrive, he will have to sit here and punch each pill out one-by-one for me and put them in a bottle.  Thought I'd give you the heads-up.  Hope everyone is staying healthy!  P.S. Are you aware of "Army of Women" (Dr. Love and Avon)           Check it out!
Posts.Title: Arimidex Packaging

Posts.Content: On 10/30/2008 Claudia413 wrote: Yes, we did discuss the new (and stupid) packaging for Arimidex.  As I stated then, Astra-Zeneca advised me when I called that each pharmacy could order the pills in either the blister pack or in bottles.  My pharmacy is now only ordering them in the bottles because of all the complaints they received.  When I picked up my pills this month, I had my bottle back.  Boy, it takes so little to make me happy...LOL.   Hi Claudia - thanks again for the suggestion.  It made so much sense.     At that time, I noted it on my calender for the next refill.  Unfortunately it is not an option - but I won't complain. I thank God for my prescription plan and will appreciate my Arimidex no matter what packaging  :-)
